subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: Vladimir Karpets of Russia won the Tour de Suisse yesterday by finishing sixth in the race’s final stage, a 21-mile time trial in Bern.Luxembourg’s Kim Kirchen finished second over all, and Stijn Devolder of Belgium was third.Switzerland’s Fabian Cancellara, the world time trial champion and the winner of the Swiss tour’s prologue, won the stage in 41 minutes 46 seconds. Karpets crossed in 42:52.“This victory comes in the most beautiful city in the world, in my birth city,” Cancellara said.Vladimir Efimkin of Russia, who led the overall standings heading into the final stage, was more than three minutes behind the leaders. He finished sixth over all.
